over25.text: How will the employer split the total contribution with covered individuals?
helpText: Since the employer has 25 or more covered individuals, it is required to pay at least 60% of the medical leave contribution. The employer is free to pay a larger portion of the contribution if it chooses to do so.

under25.text: How will the employer split the total contribution with covered individuals?
helpText: Employers with fewer than 25 covered individuals are not required to pay the employer share of the medical leave contribution, but can choose to contribute on behalf of their covered individuals into the remaining 40%.
